result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Richard Allen Michalski Jr

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Richard Allen Michalski Jr in court.  Attorney Corey R. Flynn in court for Richard Allen Michalski Jr.  Prosecuting attorney Nate Kristian McClure in court for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: SD. 
Final Pretrial held.  For reasons placed on the record, Court joins 22CM541, 22CM1392, 22CM1782, 22CM2433 for trial.  Due to Court's scheduling, Court will vacate previously scheduled jury trial date and will reset trial date.  Case adjourned, Br. 13.  Parties are advised that effective 10/31/2022, pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-17, this case will be reassigned to Branch 37, Judge Dee in Room 515 of the Courthouse.
Jury trial scheduled for December 12, 2022 at 09:00 am.
CORRECTION: Judge Konkol presided over Branch 13 on September 1st, 2022

Defendant Richard Allen Michalski Jr in court.  Attorney Corey R. Flynn in court for Richard Allen Michalski Jr.  Prosecuting attorney Thomas Hasle in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for a scheduling conference. Discussion held. Defense requests final pre-trial and jury trial dates. Jury instructions to be filed by 10/3/22.
Case adjourned.
Final pre-trial scheduled for October 17, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Jury trial scheduled for November 9, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Richard Allen Michalski in court with attorney Corey Flynn as a friend of the Court.  Nate Kristian McClure appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for bail/bond hearing. Bail motion by Defense argued and DENIED by the Court.  All conditions remain the same.
Attorney Flynn informed the Court his appointment as Public Defender representation is forthcoming and has not received discovery or offer and requests additional time.
Court ordered case adjourned for pretrial conference in Branch 13. Defendant Richard Allen Michalski in court.  Nate Kristian McClure appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 1, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Court ordered defendant to be produced for the next court date if still in custody.
Court ordered no possession or use of any dangerous weapons or firearms.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Diane C.B.
No Weapons Order, signed and filed.
Court advised Defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Richard Allen Michalski in court with attorney Corey R. Flynn.  Grant Ian Huebner appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT.
All parties are advised effective August 1, 2022 this case will be assigned to a Branch of RESERVE JUDGES.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Reserve Judge  Branch 37.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to Defendant's attorney. Defendant plead not guilty.  
Case is adjourned for a Bail Bond hearing in Branch 37.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for August 5, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Attorney Findly contact the court request an adjournment due to the client having medical issues.  The Clerk adjourned the matter for 8/1/2022 at 2:30pm.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 7/28/22 @ 2:30p
